availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: McKinley Maloney (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and pvt 3 Forks Batt Capital Guards)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Maloney. Father of William Maloney, Eleanor Maloney, Susan Maloney, Elizabeth Maloney, George Maloney, Nancy Maloney, and Donelson Maloney. Served in the Three Forks Battalion of Capital Guards as a private from August 27, 1864, to July 17, 1865. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 2, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Spruce Grove, p. 130.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lee County, Thomas Precinct, p. 11.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 782.
